title: Has anyone composed compelling music that is primarily in the locrian mode? - Quora

response.answer_text: Has anyone composed compelling music that is primarily in the locrian mode? Compelling? No. That’s not Locrian’s style. Even the ancient Greeks understood the locrian mode was wrought with tension, and they didn’t use chords the way we do. If the people who “invented/developed/discovered” the modes didn’t find it useful, there’s no reason to re-write history. Locrian just doesn’t sound finished. You can only create something compelling when it moves toward a dramatic conclusion — and Locrian never concludes!! In the end, you have to change to a different mode to get some relief. So compelling music is written in different modes to begin with, since you have to end there, anyway. . Honestly, I think the people who ask so many questions about locrian mode are just trying to up their question counts by any means possible. Give it a rest, already. There is nothing to see, or hear, here.
If by compelling you mean aesthetically pleasing, absolutely.
